=== Install the base system ===
After downloading and burning the CD for your system , boot the CD up and start the installation.

* Insert your Ubuntu Alternate Install Disk

''It is recommended you test the CD for errors before installing, to eliminate a bad installation during troubleshooting later.''

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_menu.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose '''Install a command-line system'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_1.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose your '''Language'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_2.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose your '''Country'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_3.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose '''Yes''' if you need a non-english keyboard<<BR>><<BR>>otherwise;<<BR>><<BR>>Choose '''No''' and select your keyboard layout and style from the list
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_4.png]]</nowiki>
| Enter the '''host name''' for the system
|}

'''''Partitioning Note''': This guide assumes installation to an entire drive in a system that does '''not''' require advanced partitioning. Installations of such nature are beyond the scope of this guide and you are advised to do your research '''before''' attempting advanced partitioning if you do not know what you are doing.''

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_5.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose Partitioning method: '''Manual'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_6.png]]</nowiki>
| If you are installing to an ''empty'' drive (as shown), select '''Free Space''' and press '''Enter'''
|-
| If you are installing on top of existing data- which will '''''erase all existing data on the drive''''', select the '''entire''' drive and press Enter, answer '''Yes''' to the warning, and then select '''Free Space'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_7.png]]</nowiki>
| Select '''Create a new partition'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_8.png]]</nowiki>
| This partition will be for the OS.  It should be approximately 5-10GB in size.
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_9.png]]</nowiki>
| For Type, Choose '''Primary'''- all partitions you will be setting up will be Primary partitions
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_10.png]]</nowiki>
| For Location, Choose '''Beginning'''- all partitions you will be setting up will start at the beginning
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_11.png]]</nowiki>
| Make sure '''/''' is the mount point and choose '''Done setting up the partition'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_12.png]]</nowiki>
| You will be provided with a summary screen, it should be similar to this.
|-
| Select '''Free Space''' and press '''Enter'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_7.png]]</nowiki>
| Select '''Create a new partition'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_22.png]]</nowiki>
| This partition will be used for Linux Swap and should be approximately 1.5-2 times the size of your system RAM.  This example shows a swap area of 2GB.
|-
| The type will be '''Primary''' and the location '''Beginning'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_24.png]]</nowiki>
| On the summary screen, select '''Use as:''' and press '''Enter''' to bring up this screen.
|-
| Select '''swap area''' and press '''Enter'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_25.png]]</nowiki>
| and then '''Done setting up the partition'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_26.png]]</nowiki>
| You will be provided with a summary screen, it should be similar to this.
|-
| Select '''Free Space''' and press '''Enter'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_7.png]]</nowiki>
| Select '''Create a new partition'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_14.png]]</nowiki>
| This partition will be for your media storage and will take the rest of the available space on your drive.  Press '''Enter'''.
|-
| The type is '''Primary'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_17.png]]</nowiki>
| On the summary screen, select '''Use as:''' and press '''Enter''' to bring up this screen.
|-
| Select '''XFS journaling file system''' and press '''Enter'''
|-
| <|2> <nowiki>[[File:alt_19.png]]</nowiki>
| Select '''Mount Point:''' and press '''Enter''' to bring up this screen.
|-
| Select '''Enter manually''' and press '''Enter'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_53.png]]</nowiki>
| Enter '''/var/lib''', press '''Enter''' and select '''Done setting up the partition'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_missing.png]]</nowiki>
| The final summary screen will be shown.  After double-checking the partitions, select '''Finish partitioning and write changes to disk'''
|}

* A warning screen will appear, alerting you to the changes to be applied.  Select '''Yes''' to partition your disk now.

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_27.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose your '''Time Zone'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_28.png]]</nowiki>
| Select '''Yes''' to set your system clock to UTC
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_29.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose a '''Username'''
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_31.png]]</nowiki>
| Choose a '''password'''
|}

* The Base System will begin to install... kick back, this may take a little while.

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <|1> <nowiki>[[File:alt_34.png]]</nowiki>
| When Prompted, follow the directions to reboot
|}

* And then log in with the user name and password you just set up
